content.question: What does Lydgate’s observation, near the middle of the passage, that Farebrother seemed “a trifle milder and more silent” at home reveal about Farebrother’s relationship to the others in the room?

choices.label: He is generally willing to defer to Lydgate in social situations.
He is unhappy that Lydgate has inserted himself into his personal life.
He is embarrassed by the actions of some of his family members.
He has a great deal of respect for the elder members of his family.

content.answer: He has a great deal of respect for the elder members of his family.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe how textual details reveal nuances and complexities in characters' relationships with one another.
